column4: see if this driver is compatible: http://sourceforge.net/projects/sdricohcs/
is yours built into a laptop?
I have a desktop with a built in card reader.
do you know how it's connected internally? USB?
the devices that the sdricoh driver supports is mostly found in laptops
it can still be USB, even if it's internal
the pc cover is off and it's not usb
how do I install that file I downloaded?
leave it off for now, until you know how it is connected
my bad, it is usb. I just checked again and it plugs into usb2 on motherboard
then it should be plug and play. Does it show when you enter 'lsusb' in a terminal?
yes it shows up as - Bus 005 Device 004: ID 05e3:0760 Genesys Logic, Inc. USB 2.0 Card Reader/Writer
but it doesn't detect my SD card when inserted
do a 'tail -f /var/log/syslog' and insert an SD card. Any messages?
